Performing ProximityMy research uses radio as an experimental space and employs participantobservation and interaction to reconstruct, through interactions with artists, theproduction of symbolic forms in the framework of a concept of a deliberativepublic sphere. In interview settings with artists, I accept how they communicatetheir own reality and how they narrate auto-biographical material. It is meaningfulhow they invent their realities and how these take on their own meanings.Increasingly, artists themselves are anticipating sociologists in finding ways intosocial worlds and preparing social worlds for the sociologists. Based on preliminaryconsiderations of the performative and participatory aspects of aestheticexperience, this article discusses the interrelationship between artistic productionand performative social science.
